libai.fuzzy

Class Engine

  • java.lang.Object
    • libai.fuzzy.Engine

  • public class Engine
extends java.lang.Object
    Core part of the rule system. The engine, the rules, and the sets are created, and attached to this engine instance before the inference process can start. After each run of the inference process, each rule is evaluated. The actions are executed, and the fuzzygroups are updated.
    Author:
    kronenthaler

    • Method Detail

      • addRule

        public void addRule(Rule... rs)
        Add one or more rules to this engine.
        Parameters:
        rs - One or more rules to attach.

      • removeRule

        public void removeRule(Rule r)
        Remove the especified rule from the engine.
        Parameters:
        r - Rule to be removed.

      • addGroup

        public void addGroup(FuzzyGroup... gs)
        Add one or more groups to this engine.
        Parameters:
        gs - One or more groups to attach.

      • removeGroup

        public void removeGroup(FuzzyGroup g)
        Remove the especified group from the engine.
        Parameters:
        g - The group to be removed.

      • find

        public FuzzyGroup find(FuzzySet s)
        Find the especified set among the groups. If this set belong to any group, the first group is returned, null otherwise.
        Parameters:
        s - FuzzySet to find.
        Returns:
        The FuzzyGroup where belongs, otherwise null.

      • start

        public void start()
        Run one iteration of the inference process. On that iteration, all the rules are evaluated. The results are merged according to the fuzzygroup where belong. Finally, the results are integrated (for fuzzy group) and the centroid is calculated.
